org.lemming.inputs

Class FileLocalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lemming.inputs.SingleOutput<Localization>
      • org.lemming.inputs.FileLocalizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, Localizer, Source<Localization>

    public class FileLocalizer
extends SingleOutput<Localization>
implements Localizer
    Read localizations from a file and put the values into a Store. The file must be in ASCII format, the localizations must be in the first two columns (x then y) and there must be no header in the file.
    Author:
    Joe Borbely

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileLocalizer

        public FileLocalizer(java.lang.String filename,
                     java.lang.String delimiter)
        Read localizations from filename and put the values into a Store. The file must be in ASCII format, the localizations in filename must be in the first two columns (x then y) and there must be no header in the file.
        Parameters:
        filename - - the full path of the file to read localizations from
        delimiter - - the delimiter that is used to separated the columns in the file

      • FileLocalizer

        public FileLocalizer(java.lang.String filename)
        Read localizations from filename and put the values into a Store. The file must be in ASCII format, the localizations in filename must be in the first two columns (x then y) and there must be no header in the file.

        This method will automatically determine the delimiter to use based on the file extension. If the extension is "csv" then the file is comma delimited, otherwise the file is whitespace delimited. If the file is neither comma nor whitespace delimited then use FileLocalizer(String, String) to specify the delimiter.

        Parameters:
        filename - - the full path of the file to read localizations from
        See Also:
        FileLocalizer(String, String)
